channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: us
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: us

item.title: National Guard, police confront hundreds of juveniles amid Halloween chaos in DC’s Navy Yard
item.description: A video captured chaotic scenes unfolding in Washington, D.C.'s Navy Yard neighborhood on Halloween night as police took five people into custody.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Aid efforts struggle to bring relief to parts of hurricane-stricken Jamaica
item.description: KINGSTON, Jamaica (AP) — Rescuers and aid workers fanned out across Jamaica on Saturday to distribute food and water and reach communities still isolated four days after Hurricane Melissa hit the island. Essential relief supplies are now rolling into hurricane-stricken St.
item.dc:creator: JOHN MYERS, JR., Associated Press, PHL 17

item.title: Former Kentucky Gov. Martha Layne Collins has died at 88
item.description: LEXINGTON, Ky. (AP) — Martha Layne Collins, the first and only woman elected governor of Kentucky, died on Saturday. She was 88.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, KREX 5

item.title: Uncertainty over federal food aid deepens as the shutdown fight reaches a crisis point
item.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The crises at the heart of the government shutdown fight in Washington were coming to a head Saturday as the federal food assistance program faced delays and millions of Americans were set to see a dramatic rise in their health insurance bills.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: New multistate lottery game expected in 2026 could make you a millionaire
item.description: Sure, winning a record-breaking Powerball jackpot may be cool, but what about $1 million a year for the rest of your life?
item.dc:creator: Addy Bink, KREX 5

item.title: Daylight saving time: These states want to stop changing the clocks
item.description: Nearly every state has considered legislation that would lock the clocks — here's where those efforts stand.
item.dc:creator: Addy Bink, WFLA, NBC

item.title: How does 'doomscrolling' actually affect us? Experts weigh in
item.description: While it may feel relaxing to put one's mind on pause and endless scroll the feed of a favorite app, experts are urging people to beware of certain warning signs.
item.dc:creator: Jeremy Tanner, WFLA, NBC

item.title: FBI raid at Idaho horse track shows how immigration is a top focus across law enforcement
item.description: BOISE, Idaho (AP) — The first sign something was amiss was the thwack of helicopter rotors overhead, followed by screams.
item.dc:creator: REBECCA BOONE, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Mexican Americans balance tradition and modernity in Day of the Dead celebrations
item.description: This weekend, Mexican American families across the U.S. will gather to honor their ancestors with altars, marigolds and sugar skulls on Dia de los Muertos — the Day of the Dead.
item.dc:creator: FERNANDA FIGUEROA, Associated Press, KTLA 5

item.title: Federal judge rules Trump can’t require citizenship proof on the federal voting form
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — President Donald Trump’s request to add a documentary proof of citizenship requirement to the federal voter registration form cannot be enforced, a federal judge ruled Friday. U.S. District Judge Colleen Kollar-Kotelly in Washington, D.C.
item.dc:creator: ALI SWENSON and NICHOLAS RICCARDI, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: US national intelligence director says former American strategy of 'regime change' is over
item.description: DUBAI, United Arab Emirates (AP) — The U.S. national intelligence director told officials Friday in the Mideast that America’s former strategy of “regime change or nation building” had ended under President Donald Trump.
item.dc:creator: JON GAMBRELL, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: New York Attorney General Letitia James seeks to block Trump administration's subpoenas
item.description: New York Attorney General Letitia James is challenging the legitimacy of the acting U.S. attorney in Albany as she pushes back against the Trump administration's investigation of cases she brought against the president and the National Rifle Association, according to court documents unsealed Friday.
item.dc:creator: CAROLYN THOMPSON, Associated Press, KTLA 5

item.title: Supplements sold at Sam's Club nationwide linked to salmonella outbreak: FDA
item.description: Illnesses connected to using the product have been reported in Kansas, Florida, South Carolina, North Carolina, Virginia, New York and Michigan. Three people who contracted salmonella were hospitalized, according to the CDC.
item.dc:creator: Kyler Swaim, KRON4

item.title: Air traffic controller shortages lead to broader US flight delays as shutdown nears one-month mark
item.description: Travel delays were adding up at airports across the U.S. on Friday as the government shutdown drags on, putting even more pressure on air traffic controllers who have been working without pay for a month. U.S.
item.dc:creator: RIO YAMAT, Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: Court says Border Patrol official won't have to brief judge on Chicago-area immigration sweeps
item.description: CHICAGO (AP) — An appeals court ruled in favor of the Trump administration Friday and stopped a judge from trying to get daily updates from a Border Patrol official about the government's immigration crackdown in the Chicago area. The court said the order from U.S.
item.dc:creator: CHRISTINE FERNANDO, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Fox News True Crime Newsletter: Bryan Kohberger’s cash clash, Luigi Mangione's street cred, DC sniper's reveal
item.description: Stay up to date with the Fox News True Crime Newsletter, which brings you the latest cases ripped from the headlines, from crime to courts, legal and scandal.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Melodee Buzzard disappearance: FBI, detectives execute search warrants as 'at-risk' 9-year-old remains missing
item.description: The Santa Barbara County Sheriff's Office and the FBI conduct multiple search warrants as Melodee Buzzard, a nine-year-old California girl, remains missing.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Alabama man charged with threatening rabbis, imam and others in multiple Southern states
item.description: MONTGOMERY, Ala. (AP) — Federal prosecutors have charged an Alabama man with making threatening calls and texts to multiple rabbis, an imam and others in the South, including telling one rabbi that “I want you to die.
item.dc:creator: KIM CHANDLER, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: California animal shelter rescues nearly 100 small pets from single home
item.description: The organization took in 31 mice and 63 hamsters, some of which are pregnant and expected to give birth soon.
item.dc:creator: Lily Dallow, NewsNation

item.title: Wisconsin judge puts on hold ruling that required citizenship check of voters
item.description: MADISON, Wis. (AP) — A Wisconsin judge on Friday put on hold his order that requires elections officials to verify the citizenship of all 3.6 million registered voters in the battleground state before the next statewide election in February.
item.dc:creator: SCOTT BAUER, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: The Latest: Trump wants to scrap the filibuster to end the government shutdown
item.description: President Donald Trump is calling on the Senate to scrap the filibuster, so that the Republican majority can bypass Democrats and reopen the federal government.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Coast Guard stops panga with 11 Mexican migrants near San Diego
item.description: The Coast Guard frequently patrols the waters off Southern California to deter and respond to maritime smuggling attempts.
item.dc:creator: Amber Coakley, NewsNation

item.title: Blood pressure medication recalled over potential carcinogen: What to know
item.description: Nearly 590,000 bottles of blood pressure drugs have been recalled over concerns that they may contain a potentially carcinogenic chemical that exceeds the “acceptable intake limit.
item.dc:creator: Michael Bartiromo, KRON4

item.title: Man, 39, dies after being pulled from flooded Brooklyn basement: NYPD
item.description: EAST FLATBUSH, Brooklyn (PIX11) — A man died after he was pulled from a flooded basement in Brooklyn as New York City was hit with a historic storm, according to the NYPD. A call came in for a reported person trapped in a flooded basement at 564 Kingston Ave. in East Flatbush at 4:25 p.m.
item.dc:creator: Video credit: Zhané Caldwell, NewsNation

item.title: 2 Mississippi sheriffs and 12 officers charged in drug trafficking bribery scheme
item.description: JACKSON, Miss. (AP) — Federal authorities on Thursday announced indictments against 20 people, including 14 current or former Mississippi Delta law enforcement officers, that allege the officers took bribes to provide safe passage to people they believed were drug traffickers.
item.dc:creator: SOPHIE BATES, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: King Charles III strips Prince Andrew of titles and evicts him from royal residence
item.description: King Charles III is stripping his brother Prince Andrew of his remaining titles and evicting him from his royal residence, Buckingham Palace said Thursday.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Maryland state senator indicted in alleged scheme involving filming critic in bed
item.description: Federal prosecutors unsealed criminal charges against a Maryland state lawmaker Thursday, accusing her of blackmailing a political critic by secretly recording them in bed with a married man. State Sen.
item.dc:creator: Zach Schonfeld, WGN 9

item.title: Utah man accused of throwing 6 puppies out of car on highway, killing 2 of them
item.description: Memphis Lor, 25, was arrested on seven counts of torturing a companion animal, a third-degree felony. He has not been formally charged.
item.dc:creator: Sorina Trauntvein, NewsNation

item.title: Pair get prison for assaulting restaurant host over where they were seated
item.description: The teenager who was attacked said the trouble began after he finally got them all seated at the one large table.
item.dc:creator: Sarai Bennett, NewsNation

item.title: Hegseth plans to give military speech on arms acquisition
item.description: A source told NewsNation that Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth will give a speech on equipment acquisition for "warfighters.
item.dc:creator: Kellie Meyer, NewsNation

item.title: Why you won't receive a Supplemental Security check on Nov. 1
item.description: October is nearly over, which means you may be checking your calendar to see when you'll receive your November Social Security benefits.
item.dc:creator: Addy Bink, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs seeks speedy appeals court hearing while he serves a 4-year sentence
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Hip-hop producer Sean “Diddy” Combs wants a federal appeals court to quickly consider the legality of his conviction on prostitution-related charges and his more than four-year prison sentence. His lawyers filed papers with the 2nd U.S.
item.dc:creator: LARRY NEUMEISTER, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Maine network ends primary care after losing Medicaid due to Trump defunding Planned Parenthood
item.description: PORTLAND, Maine (AP) — A network of medical clinics that serves low-income residents in Maine said it will shut down its primary care operations on Friday because of Trump administration cuts to abortion providers.
item.dc:creator: PATRICK WHITTLE, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Pulled pork sandwiches recalled over plastic contamination
item.description: The E.A. Sween Company announced this week that it is recalling a brand of its pulled pork sandwiches over concerns that there may be plastic pieces in them.
item.dc:creator: Jordan Perkins, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Gov. Landry calls on LSU to erect statue of Charlie Kirk
item.description: Louisiana Gov. Jeff Landry (R) called on his state’s flagship university to honor the late conservative activist Charlie Kirk by erecting a statue of him on campus.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Fortinsky, WGN 9
